function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increased risk perception leading to modification of destination preferences","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tendency to travel with socially close companions and avoid strangers","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 transmission through human-to-human interaction","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tourists’ expressions of conservative attitudes may impact their behavior in ways that increase the risk of spreading contagious diseases.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Tourists avoiding high-risk areas","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Behavioral changes in response to perceived risk","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Demographic variation in response to perceived risk","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Compromised destination image and tourism market due to inappropriate media coverage of the virus’s origins.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Time-related costs and frustrations due to quarantine-related measures during the epidemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of psychological distance on tourists’ risk perceptions and behavioral changes.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misleading media coverage of contagious diseases","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Stigmatization of locations affected by contagious diseases","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate labeling and misinformation about contagious diseases","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social risk related to negative attitudes from friends, family, and associates due to covid-19 travel","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Performance risk in tourism due to covid-19 travel","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social risk related to negative changes in others’ opinions and attitudes towards travelers in a tourism context","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Differences in risk perception between tourists, policymakers, and industry practitioners","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Implicit associations between proximate objects and low-level construal may affect judgment and decisions unconsciously, leading to potential misjudgments of contagion risk.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Comparison and publication of infection rates","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of viruses due to human interaction and movement","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effects of randomness in human behaviors not adequately addressed","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incorporating relationships between occupants’ behaviors and virus transmission","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on existing data may lead to overestimation of simulation validity and not account for behavioral influences.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for micro-level behaviors such as breathing and touching in covid-19 transmission scenarios","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relying solely on macro-level mobility aspects in the simulation without considering micro-level interactions within environments.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for individual and social behaviors in epidemic models and design decisions may lead to ineffective control measures.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of the influence of behavior on the spread of covid-19 may hinder control efforts and re-opening strategies.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Occupant behavior leading to virus transmission","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex human behaviors with temporal dynamics","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation through human-building interactions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited focus on long-term effects of human-building interactions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Stochastic modelling paradigms for simulating occupant behavior","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for virus transmission in early design evaluation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate analysis of space occupancy and human behavior","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential lack of consideration for other human factors in space analysis tools, such as spatial ergonomics, productivity, and social and physical comfort.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dynamic human-building interactions influencing virus transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of ability to analyze decisions within the context of relevant human-building interactions and their relationships to potential virus spread.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for social and physical interactions among occupants and the built environment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Substantial increase in time spent on entertainment during lockdown","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rise in diy and home repairs during lockdown","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in annoyance ratings due to lockdown may lead to a false sense of improvement in noise issues, potentially causing complacency in preventative measures.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Consistent high annoyance ratings during lockdown suggest underlying factors contributing to dissatisfaction with noise levels.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exacerbation of gender inequality due to the impact of the pandemic on women and girls","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Widening of income and wealth inequalities globally due to the pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of critical assessment of covid-19 impacts","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of systemic influences on impact","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Exacerbation of inequalities and poverty","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusiveness promotion must be achieved at all levels to enhance resilience and adaptive capacities.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Variation in risk communication across states leading to different risk perceptions","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of public education campaigns leading to the spread of disinformation and misinformation about diseases.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"}]}
